Package foodhub.controllers

Class AdminController

java.lang.Object
foodhub.controllers.AdminController
@RestController public class AdminController extends Object
The main controller for all Admin backend methods.

  • Constructor Details

    • AdminController

      public AdminController()

  • Method Details

    • authenticateAdmin

      @PostMapping("/admins-authenticate") public Message authenticateAdmin​(@RequestBody Authentication body)
      Authenticates an Admin login based on given login details. Always returns a Message entity, either the type of Admin logged in on success or a failure with error on failing to authorize the Admin. Errors include wrong username and wrong password.
      Parameters:
      body - an Authentication for an Admin of any type.
      Returns:
      A message with the type of Admin (either admin or owner)
      See Also:
      Authentication

    • getAdmins

      @PostMapping("/admins-get-admins") public List<AdminOutput> getAdmins​(@RequestBody Authentication body)
      Returns a list of all Admins currently saved within the Admin repository. This list can be empty, and will be so if the Admin calling it is either incorrectly logged in (wrong username or password) or is not an Owner.
      Parameters:
      body - Authentication for an Admin of any type.
      Returns:
      A List with type AdminOutput of all Admins currently saved within the Admin repository.
      See Also:
      Authentication

    • createAdmin

      @PostMapping("/admins-create-admin") public Message createAdmin​(@RequestBody AddAdminInput body)
      Allows an Owner to create a new Admin. This method will always return a Message, either a success based on correct implementation or a failure with error following failure. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, not being an Owner, the added Admin body not existing (null), or the Admin username already existing within the Admin repository.
      Parameters:
      body - AddAdminInput, includes owner login and AdminInfo
      Returns:
      Message with the status of creation (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      AddAdminInput

    • editAdmin

      @PostMapping("/admins-edit-admin") public Message editAdmin​(@RequestBody EditAdminInput body)
      Allows an Owner to edit Admin information in the Admin Repository. This method will always return a Message, either a success based on correct implementation or a failure with error following failure. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, not being an Owner, the edit Admin body not existing (null), the new Admin username already existing within the Admin repository, or the edit Admin not existing within the repository.
      Parameters:
      body - An EditAdminInput, which includes owner login, AdminInfo, and String with subject
      Returns:
      Message with status of edit (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      EditAdminInput

    • removeAdmin

      @PostMapping("admins-remove-admin") public Message removeAdmin​(@RequestBody RemoveEntity body)
      Allows an Owner to remove any Admin from the repository. Will always return a message after execution, either a success following correct information being given or a failure with an error explaining why. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, inputted Admin login not belonging to an owner, the Admin information not connected to an Admin in the repository, or trying to delete another owner.
      Parameters:
      body - RemoveEntity, which uses login information and the ID of the removed entity
      Returns:
      Message with status of removal (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      RemoveEntity

    • createFirm

      @PostMapping("/admins-create-firm") public Message createFirm​(@RequestBody AddFirmInput body)
      Allows any Admin to create a new Firm in the Firm repository. Will always return a message after execution, either a success following correct information being given or a failure with an error explaining why. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, no firm data supplied (null), or the new firm name already taken within the firm repository.
      Parameters:
      body - AddFirmInput, including Admin login details and Firm details
      Returns:
      Message with status of creation (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      AddFirmInput

    • editFirm

      @PostMapping("/admins-edit-firm") public Message editFirm​(@RequestBody EditFirmInput body)
      Allows an Admin of any type edit a Firm within the Firm repository. Will always return a message after execution, either a success following correct information being given or a failure with an error explaining why. Errors includ wrong username, wrong password, no firm data supplied (null), the editted firm name already taken within the firm repository, or the editted firm not existing in the firm repository.
      Parameters:
      body - an EditFirmInput class with login credentials, Firm data, and Firm ID
      Returns:
      a Message with status of the edit (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      EditFirmInput

    • removeFirm

      @PostMapping("/admins-remove-firm") public Message removeFirm​(@RequestBody RemoveEntity body)
      Allows an Admin of any type to remove a Firm from the Firm repository. This method will always return a message, either a success following correct information being given, or a failure with an error explaining why. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, and no such firm in repository.
      Parameters:
      body - a RemoveEntity class
      Returns:
      a Message with status of removal (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      RemoveEntity
